column4: dpkg --print-architecture shows the apt main architecture, perhaps gotten from "uname -m" (but i don't think so, they're actually separate)?
the dpkg is packages, while uname is just kernel!  and they could be mixed... not a great idea.
how does it decide if the /var/lib/dpkg/ directory is nonexistant?
SORRY i 1) don't know this specifics and 2) don't know how multi-arch plays a part.  i'm no help, sorry.
